title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Kerr,  Mr. and Mrs. Charles, of Abbotrule, ii.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The othermembers were Charles Kerr of Abbotrule (a singular being), ColinM'Laurin (insane), Colin, and I, who have luckily kept our wits.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The othermembers were Charles Kerr of Abbotrule (a singular being), ColinM'Laurin (insane), Colin, and I, who have luckily kept our wits.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Next day they all had the news that Patrick Kerr, who hated the kirk andall ministers, and had done away with the parish of Abbotrule, had diedin the darkening of that Sabbath evening and gone to his last account.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: And there wasnot one man of them but ran like hunted sheep back into the manse, andthere, in the light, faced each other, forfeuchen and well-nigh greetinglike terrified bairns, that did not know the face for that of PatrickKerr, the laird of Abbotrule.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: For four years the laird laboured to attain his end, and a blitheman was he when, in 1774, he got Eliott of Stobs and Douglas of Douglasto side with him and wipe out for evermore the kirk and parish ofAbbotrule.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Most unfortunately, too, the laird took ascunner at the minister of the parish of Abbotrule.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: The kirk andkirkyard of Abbotrule, as still may be seen, lay near the laird'shouse--too near for the pleasure of one who had no love for the kirk andwho could not thole ministers.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Not long after Prince Charlie's day there lived at Abbotrule, inRulewater, a laird named Patrick Kerr.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
